Detailed Description

Create a shader that draws a linear gradient along a line. 

 //Example: draw a circle with linear gradient on canvas.
 //create colors/positions array and also the base class - Shader
     Shader *shader;
     gaia::base::Array<uint32_t> colorArray(3);
     gaia::base::Array<float> posArray(3);
 // assign colors to colorArray
     colorArray[0] = Color::RED; colorArray[1] = Color::GREEN; colorArray[2] = Color::BLUE;
 // assign positions to posArray
     posArray[0] = 0.2; posArray[1] = 0.3; posArray[2] = 0.5;

 //test for LinearGradient
     shader = new LinearGradient(50.0f, 150.0f, colorArray, posArray);
 //set linear gradient as Shader for paint.
     paint.setShader(shader);
 //draw circle on canvas
     canvas->drawCircle(50.0f, 150.0f, 50.0f, paint);

TileMode  tile 
)

Create a shader that draws a linear gradient along a line.

Parameters:
x0The x-coordinate for the start of the gradient line
y0The y-coordinate for the start of the gradient line
x1The x-coordinate for the end of the gradient line
y1The y-coordinate for the end of the gradient line
colorsThe colors to be distributed along the gradient line
positionsMay be null. The relative positions [0..1] of each corresponding color in the colors array.
tileThe Shader tiling mode

y1The y-coordinate for the end of the gradient line
color0The color at the start of the gradient line.
color1The color at the end of the gradient line.
